conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for the ＂Ageless Artifice＂ event, as well as the main campaign through Chapter 11.
Locked on... FIRE!
Hraaah! It's OVER!
Operation complete. Minimal losses sustained.
Hee hee. Chumps like these stand no chance when you and I work together, Eirene!
▷What an incredible duo...◁ They were made with the technology of a thousand years ago, so it's only natural that their abilities would be exceptional.
Man... A thousand years ago, huh? So back in those days, civilization was, like, super advanced and stuff, yeah?
▷That's right. We were built based on the design of androids from that era.◁
But the technology in the era we were constructed was different, so we're not perfect reproductions.
▷Yeah. In terms of basic performance, Eirene and Finni have us beat.◁
Considering how nutso strong you are, that's saying a lot. And you mean to tell me their old android pals—Ex Machina, right?—might attack again anytime?
▷Yes... Though I'd really prefer to settle things peaceably, if at all possible.◁
Unfortunately, that's not going to happen.
▷Why do you say that, Eirene?◁
A thousand years ago, the scant few humanoids who remained built the Sky City Ark and escaped from the surface of the planet.
They believed that the world was taken from them by the dragons, and that those humanoids who remained on the surface were traitors who sided with the wyrms.
And we of Ex Machina were formed to serve as their agents on the ground— their sword of retribution.
Ex Machina considers those active on the surface nowadays to be enemies. That sentiment has remained unchanged for the past thousand years.
What an incredibly long time to be at odds... Man, I'd think the people up there on the Ark or whatever would long since be gone and replaced with other people.
Yes. I doubt that any of the humanoids who formed Ex Machina remain at this point.
But orders from the Ark haven't changed. Which is why the commander of Ex Machina, Anassa, still fights on.
I'm SO glad to be outta there. Anassa would never shut up with the orders. ＂Do this, do that; go here, blah blah blah.＂
Honestly, I could have defected at any point. I no longer had any reason to fight for Ex Machina.
You all have given us a chance at a fresh start. Allow me to thank you once again.
▷We're just happy to have new allies!◁ Correct. And we're counting on you.
Yeah, and you all fixing my heart was a real lifesaver. Who knows what kinda havoc I could've wreaked if I'd kept going berserk the way I was.
▷Er, well... We didn't totally fix your heart. It has too many parts that we lack the know-how and tools to analyze.◁
▷The outer shell was damaged, leaving the interior components exposed, so we just fixed that.◁
It should better resist impact now. However, the fundamental defect remains.
Ah. See, I was wondering how you were able to repair a heart. That's impossible, even with Ex Machina's technology.
(So Finni's heart remains damaged...)
(If something were to happen, it's possible she could lose control again.)
Laxi. Mascula. There's something I'd like to know...
When Laxi's heart broke and she went berserk, you gave her your heart, right, Mascula?
I did not realize you two were furnished with such a function.
▷Huh? No, it wasn't a specific ＂function,＂ per se.◁
▷It's just that Laxi and I were the same model, so I figured that she would be able to use my working heart in place of hers.◁
So... You had no proof it would work?
▷Well...not exactly.◁ Mascula can be impulsive like that.
▷At the time, all I could think about was stopping Laxi. I never would've thought that our hearts would end up merging.◁
So you had no way of knowing what would happen, then.
(Interesting. In my experience, replacing a heart won't leave memories or a personality intact.)
▷Eirene... Are you thinking of giving your heart to Finni?◁
I oppose that. We are an exception, not the rule. You cannot expect hearts to merge. There is a high possibility that you could disappear entirely.
Of course I'm not expecting a miracle like what happened in your case. But so long as Finni goes back to normal, that would be more than enough for me.
Finni has been at my side for a thousand years. She's my irreplaceable partner. I would pay any price if it meant repairing her heart.
▷Oh, Eirene...◁
If giving her my heart was guaranteed to fix her, I could accept that. But that alone won't work.
That's why I want to use you two as a reference point for a successful transplant.
That likely won't help. Mascula and I are matching models; since we are built the same, we can swap parts and still function at 100 percent capacity.
And that is why, I assume, our hearts function together even though mine was replaced. Is such a thing possible for you and Finni?
We should definitely have at least some compatibility, but I can't say with certainty that we'd function at 100 percent...
▷Exactly. That's why I'd strongly urge you to reconsider this transplant idea.◁
...Point taken.
▷Phew. I'm glad you can see reason.◁
Let's say we turned that notion around, though. So long as we DID match, it actually would be possible, wouldn't it?
▷What?!◁
I understand now what guidelines I would need to follow to be successful.
I must confirm the compatibility rate between Finni and myself.
And the best way to do that is to obtain our blueprints from Ex Machina's base!
▷You're going to sneak into an Ex Machina base, Eirene?!◁
It won't be a problem. I've already run simulations on my infiltration strategy.
If I eliminate variables, I project a 90 percent success rate. The risk is sufficiently low to justify the attempt.
▷Let's go too, Laxi. Should worse come to worst, it'd be prudent to have more firepower on our side.◁
No. I'm going alone. Forgive me, but you all are exactly the sort of variables I want to eliminate.
▷Huh? What do you mean?◁
There are some things that only Ex Machina androids can do.
I'll commence laying the groundwork for my plan. My target is...
Seems as though many of them have been abandoned in the city outskirts. Now to check their condition.
These are too badly damaged to be of any use. On to the next.
Hm... These are in even worse shape.
So few of these androids are fully intact. I suspect those that retain ambulatory functions have already returned to base.
Still, I only need one for the plan to work.
...! Yes, this one will do. Damage is within permissible limits!
Forgive me. I have to borrow some of your exterior components.
Mission phase one: complete. Now to bring these parts with me...
I've arrived near the base. Commencing phase two.
I'll detach my reinforced armor and replace it with the parts I picked up...
Component integration check: clear. All systems green.
But for this plan to work, ＂no problem＂ means there actually IS a problem! And so...
Ngh... Condition yellow. Damage to arms and legs confirmed.
Now the pieces are all in place. Commencing infiltration!
Unit returning to base.
Unit impairment confirmed. Proceed to maintenance.
Understood.
(...Maintenance complete. All is proceeding in line with my projections.)
(Now for the final phase. My target is the database in the maintenance area.)
(All the information needed to perform maintenance work is there.)
(Opening connection! Show me the blueprints for me and Finni!)
(Found them—blueprints for a command unit and for a mass-production unit!)
(All I have to do is read these, and then I can determine if it's possible for me to give my heart to Finni.)
(I'd like to analyze them right away, but first I need to prioritize downloading the data. I can't tarry here too long.)
(Commencing blueprint data transfer. 20 percent... 35 percent...)
Attention: this is a notice from the Humanoid Liberation Agency.
(...! Was that Anassa?!)
A dragon signature has been confirmed in the vicinity of this base. All functional units are to re-equip with anti-dragon armaments and report to point 246.
Understood.
(What?! A sortie order now, of all times?)
(I'll attract suspicion if I don't comply...but I'm not done with the data transfer yet!)
All readied units, move out.
(Hrk... I've got to buy more time.)
Abnormality detected in leg joint. Requesting re-servicing.
(I have to get the blueprints while I still can! Data transfer at 70 percent... 80...)
If impairment is minor, requesting that unit proceed with the operation. Scanning unit to determine level of abnormality.
No abnormality with leg joint detected. Further...
Mismatch detected between exterior components and internal construction. Unit in question is a command unit... Designation Eirene.
No! She's seen through my camouflage!
Blueprint data transfer at 100 percent! That's one objective done for now!
Terminating maverick unit. All units, adjust target from dragon to defector unit Eirene.
Command accepted.
Commencing combat simulation... Objective is to escape from the base.
Escape route secured. Commencing egress.
Order to all units: pursue unit Eirene.
Relay point reached. Commencing part replacement!
Reinforced armor equipped. Connecting circuits. All systems normal.
Eirene located. Engaging target.
I didn't want to fight any of my fellow androids, but it looks as though I have no other choice.
Target locked on. Fire!
Battle complete. That should've been the last of my pursuers.
But my sensors are picking up a number of signatures. A huge force of androids is deploying from the base.
That being said, I have put quite some distance between us. I should be able to escape the high-alert area.
Activating sensor. Commencing search for hostile signatures at maximum radius.
...All right. I think I'm in the clear.
I feared the worst when Anassa saw through my deception. What a relief.
Now to pore over the blueprint data.
Analyzing basic internal construction... Analyzing control system functions...
Analyzing design for compatibility between command and mass-production units... Analysis complete.
I finally have an answer to whether or not I can give my heart to Finni.
According to this data...it is impossible to give my heart to Finni.
No... How can I fix her heart, then?
Emergency repairs have stabilized her for the time being, but her heart has to be approaching its limit.
She's only one injury away from going berserk...or worse.
She could completely lose her heart. Her very consciousness might disappear!
I can't even fathom the idea of her being gone. She's been by my side for a thousand years now.
No. No, no, no. I will NOT let that come to pass!
Apprehending target.
What?! I'm surrounded! I can't believe I didn't notice them approaching...
I must have devoted too many resources to analyzing the blueprint.
Command from Anassa accepted. Terminating defector unit Eirene.
So many enemies... It's going to be difficult to force my way through their ranks.
This bodes ill. The longer this drags on, the more I risk being caught between the units here now and their reinforcements.
Wait... I'm picking up more enemy signatures to the rear. They DID manage to catch up to me!
I'm completely surrounded. This is the worst-case scenario. Can I even return to the Halidom safely at this point?
Forgive me, Finni. Here I was worrying about your heart breaking down, but it looks like I might stop functioning first...
Terminating target.
Hraaaaagh!
Eirene! Are you okay?!
Finni! Yes—for now, I am! But what are you doing here?!
Fight first, talk later!
Square up, you bastards. You'll pay for trying to hurt Eirene. Prepare to be decommissioned! HRAAAGH!
Enemy units terminated. Threat neutralized.
Ha-HA! How'd you like that little bit of tag-team action, punks?
You're a lifesaver, Finni. But why are you here?
Laxi filled me in on where you went.
I know you're a great strategist and all, but I couldn't help but worry. My fears were confirmed once I saw a huge fuss around the base, and...well, here I am.
I see. I'm sorry for worrying you.
I managed to accomplish my objective, but Anassa discovered my identity.
No, Eirene. That's not what I want you to apologize for.
Why were you even thinking of giving me your own heart?
Because...I wanted to fix yours, and—
But if you did that, wouldn't you end up like Mascula and stop functioning?!
I don't wanna live in a world built on the back of your sacrifice!
I could never deal with losing the person who's been by my side for a millennium!
Oh, Finni...! I...
(You don't want to lose me in the same way I don't want to lose you.)
I'm sorry... I didn't even consider how much it would hurt you to be left behind if I were to stop functioning.
As long as you understand now. But let this be the end of you trying to sacrifice yourself for me, okay?
If either one of us leaves the other, the one who remains will be lonely. When we do stop functioning, we'll do it together!
Yes. I promise, Finni. When we cease to function, it will be as one.
Yeah! It's a promise, Ei...rene...
Finni? What's wrong?
Ga...ga... Ei-Ei-Eirene... Protect...Eirene... Protect-protect-protect—
Finni?! Your heart... No, it can't be! Did the fight with those androids damage it?!
Terminating Eirene's enemy. TERMINATING—
Agh! Stop, Finni! Don't you recognize me?!
Terminating Eirene's enemy. TERMINATING—
Oh no... Has her heart malfunctioned entirely? Has she lost all control?
No...this can't be... Please, go back to normal! Finni... Finni!
Terminating Eirene's enemy. TERMINATING—
Hrk... Finni...
(She's completely lost control. And I don't have authority to force her to shut down, so I have no sure way to save her.)
(But no matter how the odds are stacked against me... I refuse to give up!)
Please! Finni, go back to normal! We promised, didn't we? We promised that we'd be together until we break down!
Pro-mise...promise... Together...
Finni! Are my words getting through?
Fooor...foorced shutdown...denied... I will PROTECT Eirene!
She regained a little bit of control! Finni's heart isn't beyond saving yet!
I know what to do now. I'll connect to the depths of her heart and call to her directly.
Thanks to the blueprint data, I've analyzed her control center functions. I can interface by breaking through her firewall!
Commencing connection!
I'm in. Is this the inside of Finni's heart?
Huh? Eirene?
Finni! What a relief! Your consciousness is still intact.
I...I can't go on anymore, Eirene. You have to destroy me. Please.
What?! What are you saying?!
My reason for being is to fight for you, Eirene. To protect and support you.
But instead, I ended up ATTACKING you!
A brokenhearted android as dangerous as me has no right to stand at your side.
So please... Put an end to me, Eirene!
I refuse.
What?! Why?! The way I am now, all I can do is hurt you!
What of it? I'd rather suffer a thousand wounds at your hand than live one day in a world without you.
Weren't you the one who said that whichever one of us gets left behind would be lonely?
But... I... I'm already—
Furthermore, your reason for being isn't to protect and support me.
Huh?
Just...be at my side. That alone is enough.
Do you remember our promise?
But is that really okay, Eirene? You'd open your arms for a broken android like me?
I need you. You, the one who has been with me for these past thousand years.
Now, take my hand. And from now on, whatever happens...never let go again.
Eirene...
I'm with you, Finni.
Thank you, Eirene. I'm going to renew our promise.
I am, too.
We're always going to be together, even after our bodies cease to be.
I can feel your heart... It's so close to mine.
I feel it too... Like our hearts are melting into one.
And so, Finni was restored, but her heart is still damaged. To be honest, I don't know what it was that stopped her from losing all control for good.
Perhaps it was the synchronization between our hearts? At this point, I hardly care about the ＂why.＂ All that matters to me is that Finni was saved.
That's enough for me...
Hee hee. When we're like this, I feel like I can rest easy, Eirene.
Me too, Finni.
We'll be together...forever.
